clinical_study.brief_title: Asthma Severity in Children and Environmental Agents

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences (NIEHS)

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences (NIEHS)

brief_summary.textblock: This study measures residential exposures (indoor allergens, mold, nitrogen dioxide, nicotine) and relates exposure levels to daily symptoms (wheeze, persistent cough, chest tightness, shortness of breath) and medication use, in a population of children with physician diagnosed asthma, followed for 12 months.

criteria.textblock:
- Siblings of a birth cohort recruited 1997-1999
- Age less than 11 years
- Physician diagnosed asthma
- Active symptoms (wheeze, persistent cough, chest tightness, shortness of breath) or medication use in the 12 months prior to enrollment.

facility.name: Yale Center for Perinatal, Pediatric & Environmental Epidemiology
